Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This class was a good survey of the basics of nuclear and particle physics.

I developed an understanding of nuclear and particle physics. In nuclear physics we covered nuclear properties, different models of nuclear physics - i.e liquid drop, shell, fermi gas. We also discussed nuclear decay and nuclear fusion & fission. In particle physics we covered the fundamental forces and their properties. We also covered symmetry and conserved quantum numbers

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This class was great because the exams were concept-based, rather than math based. The problem sets are also weighted more heavily than exams, which I prefer. I wish we got to go more in-depth during the particle physics chapter, rather than skimming past it at the end. Sometimes I felt that the lectures were a bit unclear, as it is more difficult to follow a professor reading notes than a professor writing out the lecture in front of you. However I understand that the pandemic caused limitations, and that reading through notes was the best option for Professor Baker.

I think the strength of the course was the Professor and the content. Professor Baker is very knowledgeable of the subject and he highlighted the importance of what we were learning in class to real world experiments. The content itself was also very interesting ( especially the particle physics half of the class) and made the class enjoyable.  I think one weakness was the format of the class. I think in person the lectures would have been easier to follow than online

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The format and flexibility of the psets and exams were wonderful, and didn't cause me lots of extra stress during the pandemic. The lecture style sometimes made it difficult to follow, as I would prefer the professor writing out the notes instead of reading pre-written notes.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Definitely! Great introduction to difficult concepts, but class structure makes them more approachable.
I would definitely recommend this class
If you want to learn some of the basics of nuclear and particle physics, this is a good class.
